member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.GetAttributeOf.None
member.summary: Default.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.GetAttributeOf.CanCopy
member.summary: The specified items can be copied.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.GetAttributeOf.CanMove
member.summary: The specified items can be moved.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.GetAttributeOf.CanLink
member.summary: Shortcuts can be created for the specified items.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.GetAttributeOf.Storage
member.summary: The specified items can be bound to an IStorage object through IShellFolder::BindToObject. For more information about namespace manipulation capabilities, see IStorage.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.GetAttributeOf.CanRename
member.summary: The specified items can be renamed. Note that this value is essentially a suggestion; not all namespace clients allow items to be renamed. However, those that do must have this attribute set.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.GetAttributeOf.CanDelete
member.summary: The specified items can be deleted.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.GetAttributeOf.HasPropSheet
member.summary: The specified items have property sheets.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.GetAttributeOf.DropTarget
member.summary: The specified items are drop targets.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.GetAttributeOf.CapabilityMask
member.summary: Mask for the capability attributes.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.GetAttributeOf.System
member.summary: The specified items are system items.
member.remarks: Windows 7 and later.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.GetAttributeOf.Encrypted
member.summary: The specified items are encrypted and might require special presentation.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.GetAttributeOf.IsSlow
member.summary: Accessing the item (through IStream or other storage interfaces) is expected to be a slow operation.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.GetAttributeOf.Ghosted
member.summary: The specified items are shown as dimmed and unavailable to the user.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.GetAttributeOf.Link
member.summary: The specified items are shortcuts.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.GetAttributeOf.Share
member.summary: The specified objects are shared.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.GetAttributeOf.ReadOnly
member.summary: The specified items are read-only. In the case of folders, this means that new items cannot be created in those folders.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.GetAttributeOf.Hidden
member.summary: The item is hidden and should not be displayed unless the Show hidden files and folders option is enabled in Folder Settings.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.GetAttributeOf.DisplayAttrMask
member.summary: Do not use.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.GetAttributeOf.NonEnumerated
member.summary: The items are nonenumerated items and should be hidden. They are not returned through an enumerator such as that created by the IShellFolder::EnumObjects method.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.GetAttributeOf.NewContent
member.summary: The items contain new content, as defined by the particular application.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.GetAttributeOf.Stream
member.summary: Indicates that the item has a stream associated with it.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.GetAttributeOf.StorageAncestor
member.summary: Children of this item are accessible through IStream or IStorage.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.GetAttributeOf.Validate
member.summary: When specified as input, instructs the folder to validate that the items contained in a folder or Shell item array exist.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.GetAttributeOf.Removable
member.summary: The specified items are on removable media or are themselves removable devices.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.GetAttributeOf.Compressed
member.summary: The specified items are compressed.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.GetAttributeOf.Browsable
member.summary: The specified items can be hosted inside a web browser or Windows Explorer frame.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.GetAttributeOf.FileSysAncestor
member.summary: The specified folders are either file system folders or contain at least one descendant (child, grandchild, or later) that is a file system folder.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.GetAttributeOf.Folder
member.summary: The specified items are folders.
member.remarks: Some items can be flagged with both and , such as a compressed file with a .zip file name extension. Some applications might include this flag when testing for items that are both files and containers.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.GetAttributeOf.FileSystem
member.summary: The specified folders or files are part of the file system (that is, they are files, directories, or root directories).

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.GetAttributeOf.HasSubFolder
member.summary: The specified folders have subfolders.

member.name: T:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationAttributes
member.summary: Provides information for the IQueryAssociations interface methods, used by Shell32.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationAttributes.None
member.summary: None of the following options are set.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationAttributes.InitNoRemapClsid
member.summary: Instructs not to map CLSID values to ProgID values.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationAttributes.InitByExeName
member.summary: Identifies the value of the supplied file parameter (3rd parameter of function GetAssociation()) as an executable file name.
member.remarks: If this flag is not set, the root key will be set to the ProgID associated with the .exe key instead of the executable file's ProgID.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationAttributes.OpenByExeName
member.summary: Identical to

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationAttributes.InitDefaultToStar
member.summary: Specifies that when an IQueryAssociation method does not find the requested value under the root key, it should attempt to retrieve the comparable value from the * subkey.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationAttributes.InitDefaultToFolder
member.summary: Specifies that when an IQueryAssociation method does not find the requested value under the root key, it should attempt to retrieve the comparable value from the Folder subkey.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationAttributes.NoUserSettings
member.summary: Specifies that only HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT should be searched, and that HKEY_CURRENT_USER should be ignored.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationAttributes.NoTruncate
member.summary: Specifies that the return string should not be truncated. Instead, return an error value and the required size for the complete string.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationAttributes.Verify
member.summary: Instructs IQueryAssociations methods to verify that data is accurate. This setting allows IQueryAssociations methods to read data from the user's hard disk for verification. For example, they can check the friendly name in the registry against the one stored in the .exe file.
member.remarks: Setting this flag typically reduces the efficiency of the method.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationAttributes.RemapRunDll
member.summary: Instructs IQueryAssociations methods to ignore Rundll.exe and return information about its target. Typically IQueryAssociations methods return information about the first .exe or .dll in a command string. If a command uses Rundll.exe, setting this flag tells the method to ignore Rundll.exe and return information about its target.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationAttributes.NoFixUps
member.summary: Instructs IQueryAssociations methods not to fix errors in the registry, such as the friendly name of a function not matching the one found in the .exe file.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationAttributes.IgnoreBaseClass
member.summary: Specifies that the BaseClass value should be ignored.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationAttributes.InitIgnoreUnknown
member.summary: Specifies that the "Unknown" ProgID should be ignored; instead, fail.
member.remarks: Introduced in Windows 7.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationAttributes.InitFixedProgId
member.summary: (No description available on MSDN)
member.remarks: Introduced in Windows 8.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationAttributes.IsProtocol
member.summary: (No description available on MSDN)
member.remarks: Introduced in Windows 8.

member.name: T:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationString
member.summary: Used by the GetAssociation() function (IQueryAssociations) to define the type of string that is to be returned.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationString.Command
member.summary: A command string associated with a Shell verb.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationString.Executable
member.summary: An executable from a Shell verb command string. For example, this string is found as the (Default) value for a subkey such as HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\ApplicationName\shell\Open\command. If the command uses Rundll.exe, set the flag in the attributes parameter of IQueryAssociations::GetString to retrieve the target executable.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationString.FriendlyDocName
member.summary: The friendly name of a document type.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationString.FriendlyAppName
member.summary: The friendly name of an executable file.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationString.NoOpen
member.summary: Ignore the information associated with the open subkey.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationString.ShellNewValue
member.summary: Look under the ShellNew subkey.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationString.DDECommand
member.summary: A template for DDE commands.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationString.DDEIfExec
member.summary: The DDE command to use to create a process.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationString.DDEApplication
member.summary: The application name in a DDE broadcast.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationString.DDETopic
member.summary: The topic name in a DDE broadcast.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationString.InfoTip
member.summary: Corresponds to the InfoTip registry value. Returns an info tip for an item, or list of properties in the form of an IPropertyDescriptionList from which to create an info tip, such as when hovering the cursor over a file name. The list of properties can be parsed with PSGetPropertyDescriptionListFromString.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationString.QuickTip
member.summary: Corresponds to the QuickTip registry value. This is the same as , except that it always returns a list of property names in the form of an IPropertyDescriptionList. The difference between this value and is that this returns properties that are safe for any scenario that causes slow property retrieval, such as offline or slow networks. Some of the properties returned from might not be appropriate for slow property retrieval scenarios. The list of properties can be parsed with PSGetPropertyDescriptionListFromString.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationString.TileInfo
member.summary: Corresponds to the TileInfo registry value. Contains a list of properties to be displayed for a particular file type in a Windows Explorer window that is in tile view. This is the same as , but, like , it also returns a list of property names in the form of an IPropertyDescriptionList. The list of properties can be parsed with PSGetPropertyDescriptionListFromString.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationString.ContentType
member.summary: Describes a general type of MIME file association, such as image and bmp, so that applications can make general assumptions about a specific file type.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationString.DefaultIcon
member.summary: Returns the path to the icon resources to use by default for this association. Positive numbers indicate an index into the dll's resource table, while negative numbers indicate a resource ID. An example of the syntax for the resource is "c:\myfolder\myfile.dll,-1".

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationString.ShellExtension
member.summary: For an object that has a Shell extension associated with it, you can use this to retrieve the CLSID of that Shell extension object by passing a string representation of the IID of the interface you want to retrieve as the pwszExtra parameter of IQueryAssociations::GetString. For example, if you want to retrieve a handler that implements the IExtractImage interface, you would specify "{BB2E617C-0920-11d1-9A0B-00C04FC2D6C1}", which is the IID of IExtractImage.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationString.DropTarget
member.summary: For a verb invoked through COM and the IDropTarget interface, you can use this flag to retrieve the IDropTarget object's CLSID. This CLSID is registered in the DropTarget subkey. The verb is specified in the supplied file parameter in the call to IQueryAssociations::GetString.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationString.DelegateExecute
member.summary: For a verb invoked through COM and the IExecuteCommand interface, you can use this flag to retrieve the IExecuteCommand object's CLSID. This CLSID is registered in the verb's command subkey as the DelegateExecute entry. The verb is specified in the supplied file parameter in the call to IQueryAssociations::GetString.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Filesystem.Shell32.AssociationString.SupportedUriProtocols
member.summary: (No description available on MSDN)
member.remarks: Introduced in Windows 8.

member.summary: The maximum defined value, used for validation purposes.

member.name: T:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.DfsInfo
member.summary: DFS_INFO_4 - Contains information about a Distributed File System (DFS) root or link. This structure contains the name, status, GUID, time-out, number of targets, and information about each target of the root or link.
member.remarks: A DFS_INFO_4 structure contains one or more structures, one for each DFS target.
This structure is only for use with the NetDfsEnum, NetDfsGetClientInfo, and NetDfsGetInfo functions.
Minimum supported client: Windows XP [desktop apps only]
Minimum supported server: Windows Server 2003 [desktop apps only]

member.name: P:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.DfsInfo.Comment
member.summary: A that contains a comment associated with the DFS root or link.

member.name: P:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.DfsInfo.EntryPath
member.summary: A that specifies the Universal Naming Convention (UNC) path of a DFS root or link.

member.name: P:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.DfsInfo.NumberOfStorages
member.summary: Specifies the number of DFS targets.

member.name: P:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.DfsInfo.State
member.summary: A that specifies a set of bit flags that describe the DFS root or link.

member.name: P:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.DfsInfo.Timeout
member.summary: Specifies the time-out, in seconds, of the DFS root or link.

member.name: P:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.DfsInfo.Guid
member.summary: Specifies the GUID of the DFS root or link.

member.name: P:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.DfsInfo.DirectoryInfo
member.summary: The instance for this DfsInfo instance.

member.name: P:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.DfsInfo.Transaction
member.summary: The transaction.

member.name: T:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.DfsStorage
member.summary: DFS_STORAGE_INFO - Contains information about a DFS root or link target in a DFS namespace or from the cache maintained by the DFS client. Information about a DFS root or link target in a DFS namespace is retrieved by calling the NetDfsGetInfo function. Information about a DFS root or link target from the cache maintained by the DFS client is retrieved by calling the NetDfsGetClientInfo function.

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.DfsStorage.#ctor(Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.DfsStorageInfo)
member.summary: DFS_STORAGE_INFO - Contains information about a DFS root or link target in a DFS namespace or from the cache maintained by the DFS client.

member.name: P:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.DfsStorage.ServerName
member.summary: A that specifies the DFS root target or link target server name.

member.name: P:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.DfsStorage.ShareName
member.summary: A that specifies the DFS root target or link target share name.

member.name: P:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.DfsStorage.State
member.summary: State of the target.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.MaxPreferredLength
member.summary: MAX_PREFERRED_LENGTH = -1: If you specify MAX_PREFERRED_LENGTH, the function allocates the amount of memory required for the data.

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.WNetGetUniversalName(System.String,System.UInt32,Alphaleonis.Win32.SafeGlobalMemoryBufferHandle,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: The WNetGetUniversalName function takes a drive-based path for a network resource and returns an information structure that contains a more universal form of the name.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is If the function fails, the return value is a system error code.
member.remarks: Minimum supported client: Windows 2000 Professional [desktop apps only]
Minimum supported server: Windows 2000 Server [desktop apps only]

member.summary: The NetApiBufferFree function frees the memory that the NetApiBufferAllocate function allocates.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is NERR_Success. If the function fails, the return value is a system error code.
member.remarks: Minimum supported client: Windows 2000 Professional [desktop apps only]
Minimum supported server: Windows 2000 Server [desktop apps only]

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.NetDfsEnum(System.String,Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.DfsInfoLevel,System.Int32,Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.SafeNetApiBuffer@,System.UInt32@,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Enumerates the Distributed File System (DFS) namespaces hosted on a server or DFS links of a namespace hosted by a server.
member.remarks: If the function succeeds, the return value is NERR_Success. If the function fails, the return value is a system error code.
Minimum supported client: Windows XP [desktop apps only]
Minimum supported server: Windows Server 2003 [desktop apps only]

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.NetDfsGetClientInfo(System.String,System.String,System.String,Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.DfsInfoLevel,Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.SafeNetApiBuffer@)
member.summary: Retrieves information about a Distributed File System (DFS) root or link from the cache maintained by the DFS client.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is NERR_Success. If the function fails, the return value is a system error code.
member.remarks: Minimum supported client: Windows XP [desktop apps only]
Minimum supported server: Windows Server 2003 [desktop apps only]

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.NetDfsGetInfo(System.String,System.String,System.String,Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.DfsInfoLevel,Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.SafeNetApiBuffer@)
member.summary: Retrieves information about a specified Distributed File System (DFS) root or link in a DFS namespace.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is NERR_Success. If the function fails, the return value is a system error code.
member.remarks: Minimum supported client: Windows XP [desktop apps only]
Minimum supported server: Windows Server 2003 [desktop apps only]

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.NetFileClose(System.String,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Forces a resource to close. This function can be used when an error prevents closure by any other means.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is NERR_Success. If the function fails, the return value is a system error code.
member.remarks: You should use NetFileClose with caution because it does not write data cached on the client system to the file before closing the file.
Only members of the Administrators or Server Operators local group can successfully execute the NetFileEnum function.
Minimum supported client: Windows XP [desktop apps only]
Minimum supported server: Windows Server 2003 [desktop apps only]

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.NetFileEnum(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.UInt32,Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.SafeNetApiBuffer@,System.Int32,System.UInt32@,System.UInt32@,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Returns information about some or all open files on a server, depending on the parameters specified.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is NERR_Success. If the function fails, the return value is a system error code.
member.remarks: Only members of the Administrators or Server Operators local group can successfully execute the NetFileEnum function.
Minimum supported client: Windows XP [desktop apps only]
Minimum supported server: Windows Server 2003 [desktop apps only]

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.NetServerDiskEnum(System.String,Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.ShareInfoLevel,Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.SafeNetApiBuffer@,System.Int32,System.UInt32@,System.UInt32@,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: The NetServerDiskEnum function retrieves a list of local disk drives on a server.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is NERR_Success. If the function fails, the return value is a system error code.
member.remarks: The function returns an array of three-character strings (a drive letter, a colon, and a terminating null character).
Only members of the Administrators or Server Operators local group can successfully execute the NetServerDiskEnum function on a remote computer.
Minimum supported client: Windows 2000 Professional [desktop apps only]
Minimum supported server: Windows 2000 Server [desktop apps only]

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.NetShareEnum(System.String,Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.ShareInfoLevel,Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.SafeNetApiBuffer@,System.Int32,System.UInt32@,System.UInt32@,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Retrieves information about each (hidden) Server Message Block (SMB) resource/share on a server.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is NERR_Success. If the function fails, the return value is a system error code.
member.remarks: For interactive users (users who are logged on locally to the machine), no special group membership is required to execute the NetShareEnum function. For non-interactive users, Administrator, Power User, Print Operator, or Server Operator group membership is required to successfully execute the NetShareEnum function at levels 2, 502, and 503. No special group membership is required for level 0 or level 1 calls.

Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: For all users, Administrator, Power User, Print Operator, or Server Operator group membership is required to successfully execute the NetShareEnum function at levels 2 and 502.
You can also use the WNetEnumResource function to retrieve resource information. However, WNetEnumResource does not enumerate hidden shares or users connected to a share.
Minimum supported client: Windows XP [desktop apps only]
Minimum supported server: Windows Server 2003 [desktop apps only]

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.NetShareGetInfo(System.String,System.String,Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.ShareInfoLevel,Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.SafeNetApiBuffer@)
member.summary: Retrieves information about a particular Server Message Block (SMB) shared resource on a server.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is NERR_Success. If the function fails, the return value is a system error code.
member.remarks: Minimum supported client: Windows XP [desktop apps only]
Minimum supported server: Windows Server 2003 [desktop apps only]

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.FileInfo3.UserName

member.name: T:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.DfsInfo200
member.summary: DFS_INFO_200 - Contains the name of a domain-based Distributed File System (DFS) namespace.
member.remarks: This structure is only for use with the NetDfsEnum, NetDfsGetClientInfo, and NetDfsGetInfo functions.
Minimum supported client: Windows XP [desktop apps only]
Minimum supported server: Windows Server 2003 [desktop apps only]

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.DfsInfo200.FtDfsName
member.summary: A that contains the name of a domain-based DFS namespace.

member.name: T:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.DfsInfo300
member.summary: DFS_INFO_300 - Contains the name and type (domain-based or stand-alone) of a DFS namespace.
member.remarks: The DFS functions use the structure to enumerate DFS namespaces hosted on a machine.
Minimum supported client: Windows XP with SP1 [desktop apps only]
Minimum supported server: Windows Server 2003 [desktop apps only]

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.DfsInfo300.Flags
member.summary: Value that specifies the type of the DFS namespace. This member can be one of the values.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.DfsInfo300.DfsName
member.summary: A that contains the name of a DFS namespace. This member can have one of the following two formats: The first format is: \ServerName\DfsName where ServerName is the name of the root target server that hosts the stand-alone DFS namespace and DfsName is the name of the DFS namespace. The second format is: \DomainName\DomDfsName where DomainName is the name of the domain that hosts the domain-based DFS namespace and DomDfsname is the name of the DFS namespace.

member.name: T:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.DfsInfo4
member.summary: DFS_INFO_4 - Contains information about a Distributed File System (DFS) root or link. This structure contains the name, status, number of DFS targets, and information about each target of the root or link.
member.remarks: A DFS_INFO_4 structure contains one or more structures, one for each DFS target.
This structure is only for use with the NetDfsEnum, NetDfsGetClientInfo, and NetDfsGetInfo functions.
Minimum supported client: Windows XP [desktop apps only]
Minimum supported server: Windows Server 2003 [desktop apps only]

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.DfsInfo4.EntryPath
member.summary: A that specifies the Universal Naming Convention (UNC) path of a DFS root or link.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.DfsInfo4.Comment
member.summary: A that contains a comment associated with the DFS root or link.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.DfsInfo4.State
member.summary: A that specifies a set of bit flags that describe the DFS root or link.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.DfsInfo4.Timeout
member.summary: Specifies the time-out, in seconds, of the DFS root or link.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.DfsInfo4.Guid
member.summary: Specifies the GUID of the DFS root or link.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.DfsInfo4.NumberOfStorages
member.summary: Specifies the number of DFS targets.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.DfsInfo4.Storage
member.summary: An array of structures. The NumberOfStorages member specifies the number of structures in the array.

member.name: T:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.DfsStorageInfo
member.summary: DFS_STORAGE_INFO - Contains information about a DFS root or link target in a DFS namespace or from the cache maintained by the DFS client.
member.remarks: The structure contains one or more structures, one for each DFS target. Only one target can be marked as the active target. It is possible that no targets will be marked active.
Minimum supported client: Windows XP [desktop apps only]
Minimum supported server: Windows Server 2003 [desktop apps only]

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.DfsStorageInfo.ShareName
member.summary: A that specifies the DFS root target or link target share name.

member.remarks: This structure can be retrieved by calling the NetShareGetInfo function.

Minimum supported server: Windows Server 2003 [desktop apps only]

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.ShareInfo1005.ResourceType

member.name: T:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.ShareInfo2
member.summary: SHARE_INFO_2 - Contains information about the shared resource, including the name, type, and permissions of the resource, comments associated with the resource, the maximum number of concurrent connections, the number of current connections, the local path for the resource, and a password for the current connection.
member.remarks: Share information, NT, level 2, requires admin rights to work.
Minimum supported client: Windows XP [desktop apps only]
Minimum supported server: Windows Server 2003 [desktop apps only]

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.ShareInfo2.NetName
member.summary: The name of a shared resource.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.ShareInfo2.ShareType
member.summary: The type of share.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.ShareInfo2.Remark
member.summary: An optional comment about the shared resource.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.ShareInfo2.Permissions
member.summary: The shared resource's permissions for servers running with share-level security.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.ShareInfo2.MaxUses
member.summary: The maximum number of concurrent connections that the shared resource can accommodate.
member.remarks: The number of connections is unlimited if the value specified in this member is 1.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.ShareInfo2.CurrentUses
member.summary: The number of current connections to the resource.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.ShareInfo2.Path
member.summary: The local path for the shared resource.
member.remarks: For disks, this member is the path being shared. For print queues, this member is the name of the print queue being shared.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.NativeMethods.ShareInfo2.Password
member.summary: The share's password (when the server is running with share-level security).

member.name: T:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.DfsStorageStates
member.summary: State of the target.
member.remarks: When this structure is returned as a result of calling the NetDfsGetInfo function, this member can be one of the following values.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.DfsStorageStates.Offline
member.summary: DFS_STORAGE_STATE_OFFLINE (0x00000001) - The DFS root or link target is offline.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.DfsStorageStates.Online
member.summary: DFS_STORAGE_STATE_ONLINE (0x00000002) - The DFS root or link target is online.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.DfsStorageStates.Active
member.summary: DFS_STORAGE_STATE_ACTIVE (0x00000004) - The DFS root or link target is the active target.
member.remarks: When this structure is returned as a result of calling the NetDfsGetClientInfo function, the state is set by default. If the target is the active target in the DFS client cache, the following value is logically combined with the default value via the OR operator.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.DfsVolumeStates.Ok
member.summary: DFS_VOLUME_STATE_OK (0x00000001) - The specified DFS root or link is in the normal state.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.DfsVolumeStates.Inconsistent
member.summary: DFS_VOLUME_STATE_INCONSISTENT (0x00000002) - The internal DFS database is inconsistent with the specified DFS root or link. Attempts to repair the inconsistency have failed.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.DfsVolumeStates.Offline
member.summary: DFS_VOLUME_STATE_OFFLINE (0x00000003) - The specified DFS root or link is offline or unavailable.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.DfsVolumeStates.Online
member.summary: DFS_VOLUME_STATE_ONLINE (0x00000004) - The specified DFS root or link is available.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.DfsVolumeStates.Standalone
member.summary: DFS_VOLUME_FLAVOR_STANDALONE (0x00000100) - The system sets this flag if the root is associated with a stand-alone DFS namespace.
member.remarks: Windows XP: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.DfsVolumeStates.AdBlob
member.summary: DFS_VOLUME_FLAVOR_AD_BLOB (0x00000200) - The system sets this flag if the root is associated with a domain-based DFS namespace.
member.remarks: Windows XP: This value is not supported.

member.summary: Enum for the structure.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.OpenResourceInfoPermissions.Read

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.OpenResourceInfoPermissions.Write
member.summary: PERM_FILE_WRITE (0x2) - Permission to write to a resource.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.OpenResourceInfoPermissions.Create
member.summary: PERM_FILE_CREATE (0x4) - Permission to create a resource; data can be written when creating the resource.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.OpenResourceInfoPermissions.AccessExecute
member.summary: PERM_FILE_CREATE (0x8) - Permission to execute a resource.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.OpenResourceInfoPermissions.AccessDelete
member.summary: PERM_FILE_CREATE (0x10) - Permission to delete a resource.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.OpenResourceInfoPermissions.AccessAttributes
member.summary: PERM_FILE_CREATE (0x20) - Permission to modify the attributes of a resource.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.OpenResourceInfoPermissions.AccessPermissions
member.summary: PERM_FILE_CREATE (0x40) - Permission to modify the permissions assigned to a resource for a user or application.

member.name: T:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.ShareInfoTypes
member.summary: Contains information about the shared resource.
member.remarks: Minimum supported client: Windows XP [desktop apps only]
Minimum supported server: Windows Server 2003 [desktop apps only]

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.ShareInfoTypes.Dfs
member.summary: SHI1005_FLAGS_DFS (0x0001) - The specified share is present in a Dfs tree structure. This flag cannot be set with NetShareSetInfo.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.ShareInfoTypes.DfsRoot
member.summary: SHI1005_FLAGS_DFS_ROOT (0x0002) - The specified share is the root volume in a Dfs tree structure. This flag cannot be set with NetShareSetInfo.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.ShareInfoTypes.RestrictExclusiveOpens
member.summary: SHI1005_FLAGS_RESTRICT_EXCLUSIVE_OPENS (0x0100) - The specified share disallows exclusive file opens, where reads to an open file are disallowed.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.ShareInfoTypes.ForceSharedDelete
member.summary: SHI1005_FLAGS_FORCE_SHARED_DELETE (0x0200) - Shared files in the specified share can be forcibly deleted.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.ShareInfoTypes.AllowNamespaceCaching
member.summary: SHI1005_FLAGS_ALLOW_NAMESPACE_CACHING (0x0400) - Clients are allowed to cache the namespace of the specified share.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.ShareInfoTypes.AccessBasedDirectoryEnum
member.summary: SHI1005_FLAGS_ACCESS_BASED_DIRECTORY_ENUM (0x0800) - The server will filter directory entries based on the access permissions that the user on the client computer has for the server on which the files reside. Only files for which the user has read access and directories for which the user has FILE_LIST_DIRECTORY access will be returned. If the user has SeBackupPrivilege, all available information will be returned.
member.remarks: This flag is supported only on servers running Windows Server 2003 with SP1 or later.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.ShareInfoTypes.ForceLevel2OpLock
member.summary: SHI1005_FLAGS_FORCE_LEVELII_OPLOCK (0x1000) - Prevents exclusive caching modes that can cause delays for highly shared read-only data.
member.remarks: This flag is supported only on servers running Windows Server 2008 R2 or later.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.ShareInfoTypes.EnableHash
member.summary: SHI1005_FLAGS_ENABLE_HASH (0x2000) - Enables server-side functionality needed for peer caching support. Clients on high-latency or low-bandwidth connections can use alternate methods to retrieve data from peers if available, instead of sending requests to the server. This is only supported on shares configured for manual caching (CSC_CACHE_MANUAL_REINT).
member.remarks: This flag is supported only on servers running Windows Server 2008 R2 or later.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Network.ShareInfoTypes.EnableCa
member.summary: SHI1005_FLAGS_ENABLE_CA (0X4000) - Enables server-side functionality needed for peer caching support. Clients on high-latency or low-bandwidth connections can use alternate methods to retrieve data from peers if available, instead of sending requests to the server. This is only supported on shares configured for manual caching (CSC_CACHE_MANUAL_REINT).
member.remarks: Windows 7, Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows Vista, Windows Server 2008, and Windows Server 2003: This flag is not supported.

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.OperatingSystemInfo.NativeMethods.GetVersionEx(Alphaleonis.Win32.OperatingSystemInfo.NativeMethods.OsVersionInfoEx@)
member.summary: Retrieves information about the current operating system.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is a nonzero value. If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError. The function fails if you specify an invalid value for the dwOSVersionInfoSize member of the OSVERSIONINFO or OSVERSIONINFOEX structure.
member.remarks: Minimum supported client: Windows 2000 Professional [desktop apps only]
Minimum supported server: Windows 2000 Server [desktop apps only]

member.summary: Determines whether the specified process is running under WOW64.

member.remarks: Minimum supported client: Windows Vista, Windows XP with SP2 [desktop apps only]
Minimum supported server: Windows Server 2008, Windows Server 2003 with SP1 [desktop apps only]

member.name: T:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.ObjectType
member.summary: The ObjectType (SE_OBJECT_TYPE) enumeration contains values that correspond to the types of Windows objects that support security. The functions, such as GetSecurityInfo and SetSecurityInfo, that set and retrieve the security information of an object, use these values to indicate the type of object.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.ObjectType.UnknownObjectType
member.summary: Unknown object type.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.ObjectType.FileObject
member.summary: Indicates a file or directory. The name string that identifies a file or directory object can be in one of the following formats: A relative path, such as FileName.dat or ..\FileName An absolute path, such as FileName.dat, C:\DirectoryName\FileName.dat, or G:\RemoteDirectoryName\FileName.dat. A UNC name, such as \\ComputerName\ShareName\FileName.dat.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.ObjectType.Service
member.summary: Indicates a Windows service. A service object can be a local service, such as ServiceName, or a remote service, such as \\ComputerName\ServiceName.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.ObjectType.Printer
member.summary: Indicates a printer. A printer object can be a local printer, such as PrinterName, or a remote printer, such as \\ComputerName\PrinterName.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.ObjectType.RegistryKey
member.summary: Indicates a registry key. A registry key object can be in the local registry, such as CLASSES_ROOT\SomePath or in a remote registry, such as \\ComputerName\CLASSES_ROOT\SomePath. The names of registry keys must use the following literal strings to identify the predefined registry keys: "CLASSES_ROOT", "CURRENT_USER", "MACHINE", and "USERS".

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.ObjectType.LmShare
member.summary: Indicates a network share. A share object can be local, such as ShareName, or remote, such as \\ComputerName\ShareName.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.ObjectType.KernelObject
member.summary: Indicates a local kernel object. The GetSecurityInfo and SetSecurityInfo functions support all types of kernel objects. The GetNamedSecurityInfo and SetNamedSecurityInfo functions work only with the following kernel objects: semaphore, event, mutex, waitable timer, and file mapping.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.ObjectType.WindowObject
member.summary: Indicates a window station or desktop object on the local computer. You cannot use GetNamedSecurityInfo and SetNamedSecurityInfo with these objects because the names of window stations or desktops are not unique.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.ObjectType.DsObject
member.summary: Indicates a directory service object or a property set or property of a directory service object. The name string for a directory service object must be in X.500 form, for example: CN=SomeObject,OU=ou2,OU=ou1,DC=DomainName,DC=CompanyName,DC=com,O=internet

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.ObjectType.DsObjectAll
member.summary: Indicates a directory service object and all of its property sets and properties.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.ObjectType.ProviderDefinedObject
member.summary: Indicates a provider-defined object.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.ObjectType.WmiGuidObject
member.summary: Indicates a WMI object.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.ObjectType.RegistryWow6432Key
member.summary: Indicates an object for a registry entry under WOW64.

member.name: T:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.SecurityDescriptorControl
member.summary: The SECURITY_DESCRIPTOR_CONTROL data type is a set of bit flags that qualify the meaning of a security descriptor or its components. Each security descriptor has a Control member that stores the SECURITY_DESCRIPTOR_CONTROL bits.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.SecurityDescriptorControl.OwnerDefaulted
member.summary: SE_OWNER_DEFAULTED (0x0001) - Indicates an SD with a default owner security identifier (SID). You can use this bit to find all of the objects that have default owner permissions set.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.SecurityDescriptorControl.GroupDefaulted
member.summary: SE_GROUP_DEFAULTED (0x0002) - Indicates an SD with a default group SID. You can use this bit to find all of the objects that have default group permissions set.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.SecurityDescriptorControl.DaclPresent
member.summary: SE_DACL_PRESENT (0x0004) - Indicates an SD that has a discretionary access control list (DACL). If this flag is not set, or if this flag is set and the DACL is NULL, the SD allows full access to everyone.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.SecurityDescriptorControl.DaclDefaulted
member.summary: SE_DACL_DEFAULTED (0x0008) - Indicates an SD with a default DACL. For example, if an object creator does not specify a DACL, the object receives the default DACL from the access token of the creator. This flag can affect how the system treats the DACL, with respect to access control entry (ACE) inheritance. The system ignores this flag if the SE_DACL_PRESENT flag is not set.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.SecurityDescriptorControl.SaclPresent
member.summary: SE_SACL_PRESENT (0x0010) - Indicates an SD that has a system access control list (SACL).

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.SecurityDescriptorControl.SaclDefaulted
member.summary: SE_SACL_DEFAULTED (0x0020) - Indicates an SD with a default SACL. For example, if an object creator does not specify an SACL, the object receives the default SACL from the access token of the creator. This flag can affect how the system treats the SACL, with respect to ACE inheritance. The system ignores this flag if the SE_SACL_PRESENT flag is not set.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.SecurityDescriptorControl.DaclAutoInheritReq
member.summary: SE_DACL_AUTO_INHERIT_REQ (0x0100) - Requests that the provider for the object protected by the SD automatically propagate the DACL to existing child objects. If the provider supports automatic inheritance, it propagates the DACL to any existing child objects, and sets the SE_DACL_AUTO_INHERITED bit in the security descriptors of the object and its child objects.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.SecurityDescriptorControl.SaclAutoInheritReq
member.summary: SE_SACL_AUTO_INHERIT_REQ (0x0200) - Requests that the provider for the object protected by the SD automatically propagate the SACL to existing child objects. If the provider supports automatic inheritance, it propagates the SACL to any existing child objects, and sets the SE_SACL_AUTO_INHERITED bit in the SDs of the object and its child objects.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.SecurityDescriptorControl.DaclAutoInherited
member.summary: SE_DACL_AUTO_INHERITED (0x0400) - Windows 2000 only. Indicates an SD in which the DACL is set up to support automatic propagation of inheritable ACEs to existing child objects. The system sets this bit when it performs the automatic inheritance algorithm for the object and its existing child objects. This bit is not set in SDs for Windows NT versions 4.0 and earlier, which do not support automatic propagation of inheritable ACEs.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.SecurityDescriptorControl.SaclAutoInherited
member.summary: SE_SACL_AUTO_INHERITED (0x0800) - Windows 2000: Indicates an SD in which the SACL is set up to support automatic propagation of inheritable ACEs to existing child objects. The system sets this bit when it performs the automatic inheritance algorithm for the object and its existing child objects. This bit is not set in SDs for Windows NT versions 4.0 and earlier, which do not support automatic propagation of inheritable ACEs.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.SecurityDescriptorControl.DaclProtected
member.summary: SE_DACL_PROTECTED (0x1000) - Windows 2000: Prevents the DACL of the SD from being modified by inheritable ACEs.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.SecurityDescriptorControl.SaclProtected
member.summary: SE_SACL_PROTECTED (0x2000) - Windows 2000: Prevents the SACL of the SD from being modified by inheritable ACEs.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.SecurityDescriptorControl.RmControlValid
member.summary: SE_RM_CONTROL_VALID (0x4000) - Indicates that the resource manager control is valid.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.SecurityDescriptorControl.SelfRelative
member.summary: SE_SELF_RELATIVE (0x8000) - Indicates an SD in self-relative format with all of the security information in a contiguous block of memory. If this flag is not set, the SD is in absolute format. For more information, see Absolute and Self-Relative Security Descriptors.

member.name: T:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.SecurityInformation
member.remarks: An unsigned 32-bit integer specifies portions of a SECURITY_DESCRIPTOR by means of bit flags. Individual bit values (combinable with the bitwise OR operation) are as shown in the following table.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.SecurityInformation.Owner
member.summary: OWNER_SECURITY_INFORMATION (0x00000001) - The owner identifier of the object is being referenced.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.SecurityInformation.Group
member.summary: GROUP_SECURITY_INFORMATION (0x00000002) - The primary group identifier of the object is being referenced.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.SecurityInformation.Dacl
member.summary: DACL_SECURITY_INFORMATION (0x00000004) - The DACL of the object is being referenced.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.SecurityInformation.Sacl
member.summary: SACL_SECURITY_INFORMATION (0x00000008) - The SACL of the object is being referenced.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.SecurityInformation.Label
member.summary: LABEL_SECURITY_INFORMATION (0x00000010) - The mandatory integrity label is being referenced. The mandatory integrity label is an ACE in the SACL of the object.
member.remarks: Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: This bit flag is not available.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.SecurityInformation.Attribute
member.summary: ATTRIBUTE_SECURITY_INFORMATION (0x00000020) - The resource properties of the object being referenced. The resource properties are stored in SYSTEM_RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_ACE types in the SACL of the security descriptor.
member.remarks: Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows 7, Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista, Windows Server 2003, and Windows XP: This bit flag is not available.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.SecurityInformation.Scope
member.summary: SCOPE_SECURITY_INFORMATION (0x00000040) - The Central Access Policy (CAP) identifier applicable on the object that is being referenced. Each CAP identifier is stored in a SYSTEM_SCOPED_POLICY_ID_ACE type in the SACL of the SD.
member.remarks: Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows 7, Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista, Windows Server 2003, and Windows XP: This bit flag is not available.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.SecurityInformation.Backup
member.summary: BACKUP_SECURITY_INFORMATION (0x00010000) - All parts of the security descriptor. This is useful for backup and restore software that needs to preserve the entire security descriptor.
member.remarks: Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows 7, Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista, Windows Server 2003, and Windows XP: This bit flag is not available.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.SecurityInformation.UnprotectedSacl
member.summary: UNPROTECTED_SACL_SECURITY_INFORMATION (0x10000000) - The SACL inherits ACEs from the parent object.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.SecurityInformation.UnprotectedDacl
member.summary: UNPROTECTED_DACL_SECURITY_INFORMATION (0x20000000) - The DACL inherits ACEs from the parent object.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.SecurityInformation.ProtectedSacl
member.summary: PROTECTED_SACL_SECURITY_INFORMATION (0x40000000) - The SACL cannot inherit ACEs.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.SecurityInformation.ProtectedDacl
member.summary: PROTECTED_DACL_SECURITY_INFORMATION (0x80000000) - The DACL cannot inherit access control entries (ACEs).

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.NativeMethods.AdjustTokenPrivileges(System.IntPtr,System.Boolean,Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.TokenPrivileges@,System.UInt32,Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.TokenPrivileges@,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: The AdjustTokenPrivileges function enables or disables privileges in the specified access token. Enabling or disabling privileges in an access token requires TOKEN_ADJUST_PRIVILEGES access.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero. To determine whether the function adjusted all of the specified privileges, call GetLastError.
member.remarks: Minimum supported client: Windows XP [desktop apps only]
Minimum supported server: Windows Server 2003 [desktop apps only]

member.remarks: Minimum supported client: Windows XP [desktop apps only]
Minimum supported server: Windows Server 2003 [desktop apps only]

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.NativeMethods.GetSecurityDescriptorLength(System.Runtime.InteropServices.SafeHandle)
member.summary: The GetSecurityDescriptorLength function returns the length, in bytes, of a structurally valid security descriptor. The length includes the length of all associated structures.

member.name: M:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.NativeMethods.LocalFree(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Frees the specified local memory object and invalidates its handle.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is NULL. If the function fails, the return value is equal to a handle to the local memory object. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.
member.remarks: Note The local functions have greater overhead and provide fewer features than other memory management functions. New applications should use the heap functions unless documentation states that a local function should be used. For more information, see Global and Local Functions.
Minimum supported client: Windows XP [desktop apps only]
Minimum supported server: Windows Server 2003 [desktop apps only]

member.name: T:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.Privilege
member.summary: Represents a privilege for an access token. The privileges available on the local machine are available as static instances from this class. To create a representing a privilege on another system, use the constructor specifying a system name together with one of these static instances.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.Privilege.AssignPrimaryToken
member.summary: Required to assign the primary token of a process. User Right: Replace a process-level token.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.Privilege.Audit
member.summary: Required to generate audit-log entries. Give this privilege to secure servers. User Right: Generate security audits.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.Privilege.Backup
member.summary: Required to perform backup operations. This privilege causes the system to grant all read access control to any file, regardless of the access control list (ACL) specified for the file. Any access request other than read is still evaluated with the ACL. User Right: Back up files and directories.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.Privilege.ChangeNotify
member.summary: Required to receive notifications of changes to files or directories. This privilege also causes the system to skip all traversal access checks. It is enabled by default for all users. User Right: Bypass traverse checking.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.Privilege.CreateGlobal
member.summary: Required to create named file mapping objects in the global namespace during Terminal Services sessions. This privilege is enabled by default for administrators, services, and the local system account. User Right: Create global objects.
member.remarks: Windows XP/2000: This privilege is not supported. Note that this value is supported starting with Windows Server 2003, Windows XP SP2, and Windows 2000 SP4.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.Privilege.CreatePagefile
member.summary: Required to create a paging file. User Right: Create a pagefile.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.Privilege.CreatePermanent
member.summary: Required to create a permanent object. User Right: Create permanent shared objects.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.Privilege.CreateSymbolicLink
member.summary: Required to create a symbolic link. User Right: Create symbolic links.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.Privilege.CreateToken
member.summary: Required to create a primary token. User Right: Create a token object.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.Privilege.Debug
member.summary: Required to debug and adjust the memory of a process owned by another account. User Right: Debug programs.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.Privilege.EnableDelegation
member.summary: Required to mark user and computer accounts as trusted for delegation. User Right: Enable computer and user accounts to be trusted for delegation.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.Privilege.Impersonate
member.summary: Required to impersonate. User Right: Impersonate a client after authentication.
member.remarks: Windows XP/2000: This privilege is not supported. Note that this value is supported starting with Windows Server 2003, Windows XP SP2, and Windows 2000 SP4.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.Privilege.IncreaseBasePriority
member.summary: Required to increase the base priority of a process. User Right: Increase scheduling priority.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.Privilege.IncreaseQuota
member.summary: Required to increase the quota assigned to a process. User Right: Adjust memory quotas for a process.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.Privilege.IncreaseWorkingSet
member.summary: Required to allocate more memory for applications that run in the context of users. User Right: Increase a process working set.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.Privilege.LoadDriver
member.summary: Required to load or unload a device driver. User Right: Load and unload device drivers.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.Privilege.LockMemory
member.summary: Required to lock physical pages in memory. User Right: Lock pages in memory.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.Privilege.MachineAccount
member.summary: Required to create a computer account. User Right: Add workstations to domain.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.Privilege.ManageVolume
member.summary: Required to enable volume management privileges. User Right: Manage the files on a volume.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.Privilege.ProfileSingleProcess
member.summary: Required to gather profiling information for a single process. User Right: Profile single process.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.Privilege.Relabel
member.summary: Required to modify the mandatory integrity level of an object. User Right: Modify an object label.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.Privilege.RemoteShutdown
member.summary: Required to shut down a system using a network request. User Right: Force shutdown from a remote system.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.Privilege.Restore
member.summary: Required to perform restore operations. This privilege causes the system to grant all write access control to any file, regardless of the ACL specified for the file. Any access request other than write is still evaluated with the ACL. Additionally, this privilege enables you to set any valid user or group SID as the owner of a file. User Right: Restore files and directories.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.Privilege.Security
member.summary: Required to perform a number of security-related functions, such as controlling and viewing audit messages. This privilege identifies its holder as a security operator. User Right: Manage auditing and security log.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.Privilege.Shutdown
member.summary: Required to shut down a local system. User Right: Shut down the system.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.Privilege.SyncAgent
member.summary: Required for a domain controller to use the LDAP directory synchronization services. This privilege enables the holder to read all objects and properties in the directory, regardless of the protection on the objects and properties. By default, it is assigned to the Administrator and LocalSystem accounts on domain controllers. User Right: Synchronize directory service data.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.Privilege.SystemEnvironment
member.summary: Required to modify the nonvolatile RAM of systems that use this type of memory to store configuration information. User Right: Modify firmware environment values.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.Privilege.SystemProfile
member.summary: Required to gather profiling information for the entire system. User Right: Profile system performance.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.Privilege.SystemTime
member.summary: Required to modify the system time. User Right: Change the system time.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.Privilege.TakeOwnership
member.summary: Required to take ownership of an object without being granted discretionary access. This privilege allows the owner value to be set only to those values that the holder may legitimately assign as the owner of an object. User Right: Take ownership of files or other objects.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.Privilege.Tcb
member.summary: This privilege identifies its holder as part of the trusted computer base. Some trusted protected subsystems are granted this privilege. User Right: Act as part of the operating system.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.Privilege.TimeZone
member.summary: Required to adjust the time zone associated with the computer's internal clock. User Right: Change the time zone.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.Privilege.TrustedCredManAccess
member.summary: Required to access Credential Manager as a trusted caller. User Right: Access Credential Manager as a trusted caller.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.Privilege.Undock
member.summary: Required to undock a laptop. User Right: Remove computer from docking station.

member.name: F:Alphaleonis.Win32.Security.Privilege.UnsolicitedInput
member.summary: Required to read unsolicited input from a terminal device. User Right: Not applicable.

It's not an error to attempt to unmount a volume from a volume mount point when there is no volume actually mounted at that volume mount point.
